posts.title: Fun and Charity Will Collide on the Dancefloor During the 2023 Mom Prom
posts.content:
Macaroni KID Fayetteville is thrilled to announce the return of Mom Prom to Northwest Arkansas, bringing a night of fun, laughter, and dancing for a great cause to Mount Sequoyah Center in Fayetteville on Sep 16

Ladies Night: Mom Prom began in Michigan in 2006 and has grown into a national movement to get women together for a fun night while supporting local charities. Organized by Macaroni KID Fayetteville, the NWA Mom Prom will raise funds for Peace at Home Family Shelter.

Hit the Dancefloor: Break out your puffy-sleeved prom dresses, wedding gowns, or favorite cocktail dress, and dance the night away. There will be a DJ, food and drinks, swag bags, photo booths, a Prom Queen game, and plenty more surprises.

Mom Prom is for all women, not just moms! Reserve tickets HERE.

posts.title: Ride Your Bike to Give a Bike During NWA Bike-a-Palooza
posts.content:
Several bike clubs of Northwest Arkansas have joined forces to host NWA Bike-a-Palooza, a series of group rides to raise funds for Pedal It Forward, this Saturday, Aug 19.

Join the Ride: Pedal it Forward collects and fixes used bikes and distributes them to those in need to increase bike access for health, transportation, and recreation.

Bike for Bikes: Enjoy the day with other cyclists on a road ride, mountain bike ride, or Greenway ride. Each option costs $25, which goes entirely toward Pedal it Forward, where $25 equals a bike for a kid in need.

Online registration closes tonight at midnight. Register HERE.
